page.title: 201980's FARMING - WOOKEY HOLE
page.content: A YOUNG LOCAL DAIRY FARMER SPOKE ABOUT CHANGES HE CAN REMEMBER: MILK CHURNS HAVE GONE AND HAVE BEEN REPLACED BY BULK TANKS; THIS MEANS LESS LIFTING FOR THE FARMER.MILK PARLOURS ARE REPLACING THE MILKING BALE, SO THAT IT DOES NOT NEED TO BE MOVED FROM FIELD TO FIELD. THE PARLOUR IS WARMER AND DRIER IN WINTER, BUT FIELDS HAVE TO BE CLOSE BY. BY LAW, TRACTORS NOW HAVE TO BE FITTED WITH SAFETY CABS, SO THAT IF THEY ROLL OVER, THE DRIVER WILL NOT BE CRUSHED. SILAGE IS BEING MADE MUCH MORE THESE DAYS; BIG BALE SILAGE IS ALSO BECOMING POPULAR; GRASS IS CUT WITH A SPECIAL MACHINE, THEN COVERED WITH BLACK PLASTIC BAGS.THE ADVANTAGE IS THAT BETTER QUALITY FEED CAN BE MADE WITH VERY LITTLE SUN, BUT IT IS EXPENSIVE AND TIME CONSUMING
